definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.
sentences.chinese: 記念你的一切供獻，悅納你的燔祭。

sentences.english: 3May he remember all your sacrifices and accept your burnt offerings. Selah
sentences.chinese: 記念你的一切供獻，悅納你的燔祭。

sentences.english: The holy fire from God spoke of God's presence and His acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 從神而來的聖火說到神的同在和祂的悅納。

sentences.english: Receive our praise and thanks in Jesus' name.
sentences.chinese: 求禰悅納我們奉耶穌之名獻上的讚美和感謝。

sentences.english: If ye offer in sacrifice a peace offering to the Lord, that he may be favourable.
sentences.chinese: 若你們給上主祭獻和平祭，要奉獻可蒙受悅納的。

sentences.english: God will not accept the worship of insincere hearts.
sentences.chinese: 神不會悅納虛假的敬拜。

sentences.english: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 行仁義公平，比獻祭更蒙耶和華悅納。

sentences.english: We are accepted by God in and through Christ alone.
sentences.chinese: 我們唯獨在基督裏和藉著基督，才能得蒙神的悅納。

sentences.english: May you accept what we sacrifice on this altar.
sentences.chinese: 願你悅納我們在壇上獻的犧牲。

definition: to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
to whisper to one another's ear
